From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: juni, júní, jūni, and jūnì

Chichewa

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From English June.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈd͡ʒú.ni/

Proper noun

[edit]

Júni

  1. June

See also

[edit]
Gregorian calendar months: miyezi ya chakaedit
  • Januwale
  • Febuluwale
  • Malichi
  • Epulo
  • Meyi
  • Juni
  • Julaye
  • Ogasiti
  • Sepitembala
  • Okutobala
  • Novembala
  • Disembala

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Juno (almost exclusively in speech; in order to better distinguish from Juli)

Etymology

[edit]

    From the Latin (mēnsis) Iūnius (“[month] of June”).

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈjuːni/
    • Audio:(file)
    • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

    Noun

    [edit]

    Juni m (strong, genitive Junis or Juni, plural Junis)

    1. June

    Declension

    [edit]
    Declension of Juni [masculine, strong]
    singular plural
    indef. def. noun def. noun
    nominative ein der Juni die Junis
    genitive eines des Junis, Juni der Junis
    dative einem dem Juni den Junis
    accusative einen den Juni die Junis

    Coordinate terms

    [edit]
    Gregorian calendar months: Monate im gregorianischen Kalenderedit
    • Januar, (Austria, South Tyrol) Jänner
    • Februar, (Austria, dated) Feber
    • März
    • April
    • Mai
    • Juni, Juno
    • Juli, Julei
    • August
    • September
    • Oktober
    • November
    • Dezember

    Descendants

    [edit]
    • → Estonian: juuni
    • → Hunsrik: Juni
    • → Kashubian: juny

    Further reading

    [edit]
    • “Juni” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
    • “Juni” in Uni Leipzig: Wortschatz-Lexikon
    • “Juni” in Duden online
    • Juni on the German Wikipedia.Wikipedia de

    Hunsrik

    [edit]

    Etymology

    [edit]

      Borrowed from German Juni.[1]

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • IPA(key): /ˈjuːni/
      • Rhymes: -uːni
      • Syllabification: Ju‧ni

      Noun

      [edit]

      Juni m (plural Juni or Junis)

      1. June

      See also

      [edit]
      Gregorian calendar months: Monate im gregorianicher Kalenneredit
      • Januer
      • Februer
      • Merz
      • April
      • Maai
      • Juni
      • Juli
      • August ~ Aagust
      • September
      • Oktover
      • November
      • Dezember

      References

      [edit]
      1. ^ Boll, Piter Kehoma (2021), “Juni”, in Dicionário Hunsriqueano Riograndense–Português, 3rd edition (overall work in Portuguese), Ivoti: Riograndenser Hunsrickisch, page 86

      Indonesian

      [edit]
      Indonesian Wikipedia has an article on:
      Juni
      Wikipedia id

      Alternative forms

      [edit]
      • Djuni (1947–1972)

      Etymology

      [edit]

      From Dutch juni, from Latin iūnius, the month of the goddess Iuno (“Juno”), perhaps from Proto-Indo-European *yuwn̥kós, from Proto-Indo-European *h₂óyu (“vital force, youthful vigor”).

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • (Standard Indonesian) IPA(key): /ˈd͡ʒuni/ [ˈd͡ʒu.ni]
      • Rhymes: -uni
      • Syllabification: Ju‧ni

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Juni

      1. June

      Alternative forms

      [edit]
      • Jun (standard Malay)
      • Yuni

      Coordinate terms

      [edit]
      Gregorian calendar months: bulan-bulan kalender Gregoriusedit
      • Januari
      • Februari
      • Maret
      • April
      • Mei
      • Juni
      • Juli
      • Agustus
      • September
      • Oktober
      • November
      • Desember

      Further reading

      [edit]
      • “Juni”, in Kamus Besar Bahasa Indonesia [Great Dictionary of the Indonesian Language] (in Indonesian), Jakarta: Agency for Language Development and Cultivation – Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology of the Republic of Indonesia, 2016

      Luxembourgish

      [edit]

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • IPA(key): /ˈjuːni/, /ˈʒuːni/

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Juni m

      1. June

      See also

      [edit]
      Gregorian calendar months: Méint am Gregorianesche Kalenneredit
      • Januar
      • Februar
      • Mäerz
      • Abrëll
      • Mee
      • Juni
      • Juli
      • August
      • September
      • Oktober
      • November
      • Dezember

      Makasar

      [edit]

      Etymology

      [edit]

      From Dutch juni.

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • IPA(key): /ˈɟuni/, [ˈɟʝu.ni]
      • Hyphenation: ju‧ni

      Noun

      [edit]

      Juni (Lontara spelling ᨍᨘᨊᨗ)

      1. June

      Coordinate terms

      [edit]
      Gregorian calendar monthsedit
      • Januari
      • Peberiwari
      • Maraʼ
      • Apariliʼ
      • Mei
      • Juni
      • Juli
      • Aguttusuʼ
      • Sitembereʼ
      • Ottobereʼ
      • Nopembereʼ
      • Desembereʼ

      Further reading

      [edit]
      • Cense, A. A. (1979), Makassaars-Nederlands woordenboek, 's-Gravenhage: Martinus Nijhoff, →ISBN

      Norwegian

      [edit]

      Etymology

      [edit]

      From juni (“June”), partly as a translation of the English given name June.

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Juni

      1. a female given name

      Plautdietsch

      [edit]

      Noun

      [edit]

      Juni m (plural Junis)

      1. June

      Swahili

      [edit]
      Swahili Wikipedia has an article on:
      Juni
      Wikipedia sw

      Etymology

      [edit]

      Borrowed from English June.

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • Audio (Kenya):(file)

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Juni

      1. June

      See also

      [edit]
      Gregorian calendar months: miezi ya mwaka[c 1]edit
      • Januari
      • Februari
      • Machi
      • Aprili
      • Mei
      • Juni
      • Julai
      • Agosti
      • Septemba
      • Oktoba
      • Novemba
      • Desemba
      1. ^ Months are more commonly referred to by number rather than name, e.g. mwezi wa kwanza, mwezi wa pili, mwezi wa kumi na mbili rather than Januari, Februari, Desemba.

      Tumbuka

      [edit]

      Etymology

      [edit]

      From English June.

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Juni

      1. June

      See also

      [edit]
      Gregorian calendar months: miyezi ya cirumikaedit
      • Janyuwale
      • Febuluwale
      • Malichi
      • Epulo
      • Meyi
      • Juni
      • Julayi
      • Ogasiti
      • Seputembala
